event.doc_name: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: In April 2025, the Department of Justice’s Office of Justice Programs abruptly and summarily terminated more than 370 multi‑year cooperative agreements and grants awarding more than $820 million in essential funding.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: In April 2025, the Department of Justice’s Office of Justice Programs abruptly and summarily terminated more than 370 multi‑year cooperative agreements and grants awarding more than $820 million in essential funding.

evidence.text: OJP sent a form email to Plaintiffs and other grantees offering the same unsupported explanation that Plaintiffs’ “awards no longer effectuate the program goals or agency priorities.”
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: OJP sent a form email to Plaintiffs and other grantees offering the same unsupported explanation that Plaintiffs’ “awards no longer effectuate the program goals or agency priorities.”

evidence.text: OJP ordered the grantees to stop work immediately and informed them that they would be reimbursed only up to the date of the termination letter.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: OJP ordered the grantees to stop work immediately and informed them that they would be reimbursed only up to the date of the termination letter.

evidence.text: The terminated grants cut across a broad swath of critical programs and have a successful track record of making our communities safer, including violence reduction, policing, victim services, juvenile justice, etc.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: The terminated grants cut across a broad swath of critical programs and have a successful track record of making our communities safer, including violence reduction, policing, victim services, juvenile justice, etc.

evidence.text: Plaintiffs are non‑profit organizations that were awarded federal grant funding.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiffs are non‑profit organizations that were awarded federal grant funding.

evidence.text: As a direct result of OJP’s unlawful termination of Plaintiffs’ grants, services to many populations have abruptly ceased, staff have been laid off, and many more staff will soon be laid off.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: As a direct result of OJP’s unlawful termination of Plaintiffs’ grants, services to many populations have abruptly ceased, staff have been laid off, and many more staff will soon be laid off.

evidence.text: OJP’s abrupt termination had an immediate and irreparable impact on Plaintiff organizations, their staff, and the individuals and communities they serve.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: OJP’s abrupt termination had an immediate and irreparable impact on Plaintiff organizations, their staff, and the individuals and communities they serve.

evidence.text: Plaintiffs did not receive prior notice before OJP summarily terminated its grant terminations and ceased disbursing funds owed on them.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiffs did not receive prior notice before OJP summarily terminated its grant terminations and ceased disbursing funds owed on them.

evidence.text: OJP’s termination deprived Plaintiffs of their protected property interest in the grant funding.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: OJP’s termination deprived Plaintiffs of their protected property interest in the grant funding.

evidence.text: OJP’s basis for terminations was that the grants no longer effectuate the program goals or agency priorities.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: OJP’s basis for terminations was that the grants no longer effectuate the program goals or agency priorities.

evidence.text: OJP’s termination was not authorized by Section 200.340(a)(4) because it was not on an award‑by‑award basis and did not rely on specific evidence.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: OJP’s termination was not authorized by Section 200.340(a)(4) because it was not on an award‑by‑award basis and did not rely on specific evidence.

evidence.text: OJP withheld $820 million in appropriated funds and denied more than 370 grants.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: OJP withheld $820 million in appropriated funds and denied more than 370 grants.

evidence.text: OJP’s action violated the APA, Fifth Amendment Due Process Clause, and constitutional separation of powers.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: OJP’s action violated the APA, Fifth Amendment Due Process Clause, and constitutional separation of powers.

evidence.text: OJP was directed to terminate 376 individual, specifically identified discretionary grant awards (to 219 recipients), on the basis of the Department determination that they ‘no longer effectuate[d] Department priorities.’
evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion

add_extracted.value: OJP was directed to terminate 376 individual discretionary grant awards (to 219 recipients) on the basis that they no longer effectuate Department priorities.

evidence.text: Defendants have offered zero insight into what criteria they used to evaluate the project descriptions, reduce the number of awards under “active focus,” and determine which of them would ultimately be terminated.
evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion

add_extracted.value: Defendants offered zero insight into the criteria used to evaluate project descriptions, reduce the number of awards under “active focus,” or determine which awards would ultimately be terminated.

evidence.text: The record includes the termination notices that OJP delivered to the five Plaintiff- organizations, all of which are identical. See Pls.’ Mot. for Prelim. Inj., ECF No. 3 [hereinafter Prelim. Inj. Mot.], Decl. of Rachel Sottile, ECF No. 3-3 [hereinafter Sottile Decl.], Exs. 2, 4 (Center for Children & Youth Justice’s termination letters); Prelim. Inj. Mot., Decl. of Cynthia Choi, ECF No. 3-4 [hereinafter Choi Decl.], Ex. 2 (Stop AAPI Hate’s termination)
evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion

add_extracted.value: The record includes termination notices delivered to five plaintiff organizations, all identical, with references to Sottile and Choi termination letters.

evidence.text: This case is about grants terminated by the Department of Justice’s Office of Justice Programs.
evidence.source_document: Order

add_extracted.value: This case is about grants terminated by the Department of Justice’s Office of Justice Programs.

evidence.text: Plaintiffs seek reinstatement of their grant funding in addition to other declaratory and injunctive relief.
evidence.source_document: Order

add_extracted.value: Plaintiffs seek reinstatement of their grant funding in addition to other declaratory and injunctive relief.
